12 people were killed and at least 30 wounded after an attack. It is unknown whether or not attackers were killed.[70]
At least 19 people were killed and over 50 injured after a car bombing in a market and neighbourhood.[68][69]
1 person was  killed and 3 wounded after a bombing that hit a family that was escaping ISIS.[71]
A wave of attacks in Aleppo left at least 54 dead and 93 injured. The attacks included shellings that killed people and destroyed buildings.[72]
A woman was stoned to death on charges of "adultery".[73]

Nityaranjan Pande, a worker at a Hindu monastery in Bangladesh, was hacked to death by several people near the monastery. No immediate claim of responsibility was made but Islamists are suspected.[74]
dataA.partOf: Internal conflict in Bangladesh, Attacks on secularists in Bangladesh (broad attacks)

dataA.details: Three men were shot dead and another beheaded in the Bay region by Al-Shabaab for giving information to the United States which led to the death of the group leader.[75]
3 people were  killed and 11 wounded after a suicide bombing  at a security checkpoint.[76]
Two unity government soldiers were killed and seven were injured in clashes with ISIS fighters. 30 more were killed and 50 injured.[78]
ISIS opened fire on fleeing civilians, killing at least 30.[79]
At least 4 civilians were killed and around 60 injured after an IED bombing during prayer inside of a mosque. The death toll is likely higher than 4. An imam was among those killed.[80][81]
1 person was  killed and 8 wounded after a bombing near a market.[82]
Two army officials had their houses stormed by gunmen and many of their family members killed.[83]
ISIS executed 10 people on an unknown date, and their remains were only found today.[84]
2 people were injured in an IED explosion.[85]
ISIS attacked a police headquarters, killing a police chief and 4–13 others. 13 attackers were killed, 7 were injured, and 6 of the victims were also injured.[86]

Two Kenyans were executed by Al-Shabaab for spying for Kenyan and western intelligence agencies. The victims were Jared Mukae Ombamba 31 from Eldoret and 22 years old Abdullah Faraj from Mombasa, Kenya.[87]
At least 20 people were killed and 30 injured after two bombings near a Shia shrine in the capital.[88]

ISIS massacred 40 civilians, and killed 6 more later on by shelling them. 35 were injured by the shelling, and an unknown number of people were injured by the shootings. ISIS was disguised as Kurdish fighters. 3 more were killed and 15 injured in a sniping attack.[72]

A young man was brutally executed by the Taliban, who are reportedly trying to "mimic ISIS's methods". The execution process included things such as skinning alive and the victims eyes being gouged out. He was then thrown of a 10-storey cliff. A video was released by the Taliban showing the execution.[89]

2016 Orlando nightclub shooting: 49 people were killed when an alleged lone-wolf gunman entered the Pulse gay nightclub. Hostages were taken and the perpetrator, Omar Mateen, was shot dead by local SWAT units in an attempt to storm the building. The FBI classified the attack as an act of "domestic terrorism" motivated by "Islamic leanings".[90] An accomplice has been identified and is expected to be apprehended.[91]
1 person was killed and 6 injured after a bombing near shops.[92]
4 women were killed by 14 assailants after being dragged outside of their homes.[93]

A small bomb exploded outside the Central Bank of Lebanon, injuring two people and shattering glass. No group claimed responsibility, but Hezbollah is suspected as the bank was involved in an American backed act that would attempt to stop the flow of money to Hezbollah.[94]
dataA.partOf: Syrian Civil War spillover in Lebanon

dataA.details: 3 suicide bombers killed 3 people and injured "dozens' after an attack on soldiers and medical workers at a hospital, causing damage. The death toll is disputed.[95][96]

June 2016 Paris police stabbing: A man shouting "Islamist slogans" stabbed his neighbor, a 42-year-old police officer, to death before taking the officer's wife and son hostage. Police raided the house and killed the attacker and discovered the officer's wife dead but his son alive. ISIS claimed responsibitiy.[97]
ISIS executed 19 people for fleeing from a battle.[98]
Unknown militants shot dead an army officer.[99]
A terrorist attack by ISIS was stopped by policeman, and an unknown number of assailants were killed.[100]
1 person was killed and 2 injured after a sniping attack on a military checkpoint.[101]
6 ISIS suicide bombers were killed, it is unknown if they killed anyone before they were killed by security forces.[102]

A Canadian hostage was executed by a terrorist group connected to Al-Qaeda after he was abducted along with two others, the second execution of a Canadian in a short time period in the Philippines.[103]
A video showed an ISIS militant executing his brother and another person for suspected spying. They were both shot dead.[104]
At least 5 people were killed and 11 in injured after a suicide attack on an army base.[105]
ISIS attacked security forces, and 40 of them were killed. The number of victims (if there are any) is unknown.[106]
3 soldiers were injured by an explosion. A vehicle was also damaged.[107]
2 people were killed and 9 injured after an IED bombing near a market.[108]
1 person was killed and 7 injured after bombing in a street.[109]
10 fishermen were killed by militants, and soon after 42 more were killed by Boko Haram at Lake Chad.[110]

A double terrorist attack in India resulted in the death of a victim and a militant, and the injury of 9. The status of the second attacker is currently unknown. The attack sparked protests, as it was later revealed that two civilian victims were actually shot by Indian troops amid the chaos.[15][111][112]
A soldier blew himself up with grenade, killing him and two other people as well as injuring four other people in the town of Ngozi in Ngozi Province.[113]
2 people were killed and 7 injured after bombing near markets.[114]
An employee of the Iraqi Justice Ministry was killed along with her son when unknown gunmen stormed her house.[115]
1 person was killed and 5 injured after an IED bombing near a market.[116]
2 people were killed and 3 injured after a suicide bombing near an army post on a major highway.[117]

There is currently an ongoing clash between Iraqi policemen and ISIS militants, with a current unknown number of casualties. Airstrikes have been called in, and the clash has been described as "violent".[118]

At least 4 females were killed and several abducted after many Boko Haram militants attacked a village. Some sources say the number of those kidnapped is four. Many houses were burned down and shot at. Vigilantes followed the attackers and rescued one of the kidnapped after a gun battle. A vigilante was injured.[119]
A transgender man was stabbed by people who were described as Islamic state members.[120]
9 people were killed and over 8 injured after a suicide bombing and another bombing.[121]
2 people were killed and 3 injured after an IED bombing that targeted a police patrol, also damaging a vehicle.[122]
3 people were killed and 4 injured after ISIS attacked soldiers, and 4 of the assailants were killed.[123]
A sniper who targeted fleeing civilians killed a 2-year-old boy and injured her mother in the Euphrates River.[124]
4 men were stoned to death near the Tigris river for committing "adultery".

6 men part of a scouting unit for the Libyan army were captured by ISIS.[125]  They were executed and pictures of their bodies were posted online. Later on, two suicide bombers killed over 16 more people and injured 7.[126][127]
At least 10 people were killed and several injured after armed attackers attacked a region. They now occupy the region.[128]
dataA.perpetrator: Fulani, ex-Seleka members, and Fulani herdsmen (suspected)

dataA.details: ISIS crucified 3 people for breaking fast during Ramadan.[129] ISIS has also crucified more people, but the exact number is unknown.[130]
Murder of Jo Cox: Labour Member of Parliament Jo Cox is assassinated by Thomas Mair, a neo-Nazi constituent.[131]
At least 24 people were killed and at least 10 injured after Boko Haram militants attacked a funeral.[133]
An unknown number of people were killed and injured after a suicide bombing attack, another on a series of attacks in the same city.
7 people were killed and 12 injured after an attack on policemen.[134]
One person was killed and 3 injured after a bombing by militants that targeted policemen.[135]
Three people were killed and 10 injured (some serious) after a suicide bombing on the Patriotic Union of Kurdistan headquarters.[136]
4 people were killed and after failing to dismantle an IED inside of a house. The victims were volunteer members of al-Hashd al-Shaabi.[137]
3 escaping civilians were kidnapped and executed by firing squads after attempting to flee ISIS.[138]
3 people were killed after being shot by gunmen inside an agricultural grove. The victims were volunteer members of al-Hashed al-Sha'bi.[139]
7 people were killed after an attack on a Kurdish family. 210 other Kurds were kidnapped by ISIS.[141]
6 members of a family were kidnapped for trying to escape ISIS by firing squad.[142]
1 person was killed and 4 injured after a shelling attack. The person killed was Lieutenant Colonel Hashim Ismail.[143]
A suicide attack was foiled in an orchard by security forces, killing 5 assailants, and leaving an unknown number of other people killed or injured.[144]
3 people were injured and a vehicle damaged after a bombing on army members.[145]
2 ISIS vehicles were destroyed, one containing a suicide bomber who was killed.[146]
2 people were killed and 9 in injured after a bombing near a market.[147]
1 person was killed after an IED bombing near a fertilizer plant.[148]
2 people were injured in a bombing on a road. One person is in critical condition.[149]

Kabul attack on Canadian Embassy Guards: At least 14 or 16 Afghan, Nepali, and Indian security contractors were killed and 9 others were injured when a suicide bomber detonated outside the minibus they were in.[150] The people killed were security guards at the Canadian embassy, and Prime Minister Justin Trudeau condemned the killings.[151]
1 person was killed and 4 injured after an IED bombing. All of the victims were family members trying to escape ISIS.[152]
3 people were killed and 10 injured after a suicide bombing at the al-Taji Camp.[153]
1 person was killed and 8 injured (some serious) after an IED bombing near a market.[154]
An assassination attempt on a politician killed one and injured 5 others, including the politician.[155]
At least 10 people were killed and 40 injured after a bombing in a town square.[156]
At least 2 people were killed after several Boko Haram militants attacked a village, the second attack there by them in a week.
An ISIS sniper killed , Lieutenant Colonel Abbas Abdul-Reda, an important commander in the Iraqi army.[157]
4 people were killed and 5 injured by a suicide bomber who blew himself up while being searcher by policemen.[158]
The media officer of al-Hashd al-Shaabi was injured in a bombing.[159]

6 Jordanian soldiers were killed and 14 Jordanians were injured by a suicide bombing on a border military post in the Rukban Refugee Camp, a makeshift Syrian refugee camp in the extreme northeastern point between Syria and Jordan.[160]
A  homeopathic doctor was shot dead by unknown gunmen. The victim was an Ahmadi minority.
During a raid, police killed 3 trainers of suicide bombers who were involved in a terrorist attack in that killed over 20 people.[161]
3 people were executed by ISIS in their self-proclaimed state on an island.[162]
ISIS blew up 5 transmission towers with IEDs.[163]
An IED bombing wounded 4 civilians.[164]
2 people were injured after a shelling attack. Houses were also damaged by the mortars.[165]
1 person was killed and 5 injured after an IED bombing near shops.[166]
1 person was killed and 4 injured after an IED bombing targeting policemen. A vehicle was also damaged.[167]

Amjad Sabri, a popular Pakistani Qawwali Sufi was shot dead by motorcycle-riding Taliban gunmen while driving his car in Karachi. A relative was injured.[168]  The attack was condemned nation wide, with Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif  also condemning the attack. His funeral was attended by thousands with a Baba Farid descendent leading it.[169]
At least 37 people were killed and 100 injured after a clash between security forces and ISIS. "Dozens" of assailants were killed.[170] 18 more were killed later on.[171]
30 people were killed and dozens more injured after an explosion at an ammunitions depot.[171]
A tribal leader and his son were killed and another person injured after a house was shot at and burned down by ISIS.[172]
2 people were killed and 5 injured after a bombing near a confectionery factory.[173]
A policeman was killed after being shot at by militants.[174]
1 person was killed and 4 injured after an IED bombing targeting al-Hashd al-Shaabi.[175]
1 person was killed and 8 injured after a bombing near a market.[176]
5 civilians were executed by ISIS after being charged for allegedly cooperating with the government.[177]

A Palestinian terrorist driving his car crashed into a couple of Israelis at the entrance to Kiryat Arba. The couple was slightly injured. and soldiers present on the ground have eliminated terrorist.[178]
Five people were killed and fourteen were injured in a car bombing in Benghazi at the Jalaa hospital.[179]
An ISIS sneak-attack was foiled, with 6 of them killed and their vehicle destroyed.[180]

8 people were killed after ISIS attacked a civilians village, burning down 25 houses. At least 27 were injured.[181] Military forces quickly repelled the attack and killed around 135 assailants in the process.[182] At least 12 soldiers were also killed in the process.[183]
June 2016 Mogadishu attacks: Al-Shabaab terrorists detonated a car bomb outside a hotel popular with foreigners and tourists before storming the building and taking hostages.
3 people were killed after an IED bombing that targeted policemen.[184]
A grenade exploded outside a stadium in Antananarivo where people were celebrating Madagascar's independence; one of the wounded later died in the hospital [185]
1 person was killed and 4 injured after an IED bombing that targeted al-Hashd al-Shaabi members.[186]
An ISIS terrorist attacks was foiled and over 25 assailants were killed.[187]

8 people were killed and 20 injured after a shooting attack, where the two attackers were also killed. Some people were critically injured.[188] The attacks come after another attack that injured 4 policemen at a party, and after a top LeT commander was arrested.[189]
At least 4 civilians were killed  in another in a series off attacks by Boko Haram militants.[190]
A working policeman was shot dead.[191]
At least 5 people were killed after militants attacked an Ethiopian military base.[192] The death toll of the Al Shabaab militants are currently unknown.
2 people were killed and 1 injured after a bombing on a road.[193]
1 person was killed and 8 injured after a bombing near shops.[194]

Buddhist extremists rampaged a village containing a Rohingya Muslims minority, forcing 70 people to seek shelter and others to flee. Only one man was confirmed injured, yet in  the past other raids by Buddhist extremists have killed people, as this attack is another in a series conducted by them.[195]

A series of explosions hit the predominantly Christian town of Qaa  where at least four suicide bombers detonated their load, according to a military source. The first attacker blew himself up in front of a house in the village. Alerted, the residents gathered at the site and it is at this time that the three other bombers went into action.[196] More bombers blew themselves up at a funeral that was being organized for those that were killed earlier.[197]

June 2016 Mukalla attacks: At least seven bombings were simultaneously targeted checkpoints in the port city, followed by a fourth that struck the entrance to a military camp. At least 43 people were killed, other sources claiming 50.[198][199]
2 people were killed after a shooting in an orchard.[200]
1 person was killed and 8 injured after an IED bombing near an industrial area.[201]
2 people were killed and 5 injured after an IED bombing near shops.[202]

2016 Movida Bar grenade attack:8 people were injured after a grenade attack on patrons at the Movida nightclub watching a UEFA European Championships match. The attack was initially thought to be gang-related or due to a business dispute but was later to be found out to be tied to the Islamic State group. The bombing is believed to be the first IS-related attack on Malaysia. According to the Malaysian police, Two people were arrested in July who were ordered by alleged Malaysian IS fighter Muhammad Wanndy Mohamed Jedi.[203] However, Muhammad Wanndy denied that he ordered the attack and said that the two arrested men are Islamic State supporters.[204]
2016 Atatürk Airport attack: Three suicide attackers opened fire on and blew themselves up at Atatürk Airport in Istanbul.
1 person was killed and 5 injured after a bombing in al-Tobji area.[205]
4 people were executed by ISIS after 15 people were kidnapped for allegedly working with the government.[206]
A terrorist attack was thwarted and 12 assailants were killed.[207]
4 people were killed after gunmen stormed a civilian house.[208]
An ISIS attack was foiled by a coalition of soldiers and policemen.[209]
14 people were killed and 32 injured after a suicide bombing at a Sunni mosque in Abu Ghraib.[210][211]
A Hindu Ayurvedic practitioner was hacked to death and beheaded.[212]
1 person was killed and 8 injured after an IED bombing near shops.[213]
2 people were killed and 8 injured after a mortar attack by ISIS targeting escaping civilians.[214]
3 people were killed and 7 injured after a bombing near a market.[215]

At least 10 people were killed and 25 injured after a suicide bomber drove his car into a building and blew himself up.[216]  Four more people were killed and 12 injured after a rocket attack onto a neighborhood.[217]
3 people were killed and 6 injured after a terrorist attack on soldiers.[218]

19-year-old Palestinian broke into the bedroom of a 13-year-old girl in a Jewish settlement and stabbed her to death. The attacker was shot dead. Another man was wounded in the fire exchange [219][220]
A Palestinian from Tulkarm stabbed a man and an elderly woman in Natanya before being shot dead by an armed civilian after a pursuit.[221][222]

A Coptic priest named Mussa Azmy was shot in the head at a street in Arish and was killed. Islamic State-affiliated Wilayat Sayna claimed responsibility, saying the priest was killed for "warrior against Islam".[223]
Militants detonated a bomb near a hospital in Arish, killing one policemen and wounding another two. Islamic State-affiliated Wilayat Sayna claimed responsibility.[223]

Militants detonated a bomb in a village near Rafah, badly wounding an Egyptian soldier. When escorting the soldier in an ambulance, militants ambushed the ambulance, killing another soldier and wounded the same soldier who was injured in the earlier blast. Islamic State-affiliated Wilayat Sayna claimed responsibility.[223]
6 people were killed and 19 injured after a suicide bombing at a market.[224]
3 people were killed and 9 injured after an IED bombing near a market.[225]
One person was killed after a gunman stormed a house and stole dinars.[226]
1 person was killed and 7 injured after a bombing near shops.[227]

30 June 2016 Afghanistan bombings: At least 40 people were killed and 50 were injured after two Taliban suicide bombers attacked police cadets returning from a graduation ceremony outside of the capital Kabul.[228][229]
At least 15 people were killed and dozens injured after a suicide bombing that targeted a mosque and a video club.[230]

At least 18 people were killed after a bomb on a roadside went off when a minibus containing a large amount of people passed over it. There were no survivors of the blast in the minibus. The target, a government vehicle, was missed in the bombing, and the blast instead struck the minibus.[231]
A man with extremist views allegedly influenced by ISIS killed his brother, who as the suspect said "did not perform regular prayers and was not religious".
Two adult twin brothers allegedly influenced by ISIS killed their mother and injured two other members of their family for not joining ISIS.[232] The mother's funeral was attended by hundreds.
4 people were killed and 5 injured after an attack on policemen.[233]
3 people were killed and 6 injured after three attacks on policemen, injuring civilians, some seriously.[234]
6 people were killed and 3 injured after a targeted attack on security forces.[235]

1 person was killed and 3 injured after a roadside bombing. 2 people were arrested who were suspected of planting the bomb. Bahrain accused Iran's Revolutionary Guards for being behind the bombing, although this is only an accusation, and does not rule out the possibility of terrorism. U.S. Vice President Joe Biden expressed his concerns after the attack.[236] The bombing was described as a "terrorist bombing".[237]

Militants detonated a bomb in a village south of Bahrain's capital Manama, hitting a car carrying four passengers, including a woman who died in the blast and three children who sustained minor injuries. Bahraini authorities said the attack was carried out by "terrorists", but no group claimed responsibility.[1]

Gunmen in a passing vehicle fired at a family vehicle on Route 60 south to Hebron, killing a Jewish yeshiva head from Otniel, causing the vehicle to flip over. His wife was critically injured and his two teenage daughters were lightly injured. The gunmen fled and no group claimed responsibility.[2] On July 27, 2016, the Israeli military conducted a pre-dawn raid which resulted in the death of the suspected perpetrator[3]

dataA.location: Masisi Territory, Democratic Republic of Congo
dataA.details: The Nyatura and the Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo simultaneously attacked several Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo positions in the Masisi Territory.[4]

Gunmen fired at two buses within Kenya's Mandera County on the border with Somalia, killing at least six civilians. No group claimed responsibility, but al-Shabaab is suspected.[5] Two people are reported to have been injured.[citation needed]
Six people were killed and nineteen others injured when a suicide bomber blew himself up at a busy market area in western Baghdad.[6][7]
Six people, including children, were killed aboard a bus during an attack by religious radicals in Kenya.[citation needed]

July 2016 Dhaka attack: A number of gunmen attacked a restaurant popular with foreigners in the wealthy Gulshan Thana area of Dhaka. At least twenty-two civilians, two police officers, and five attackers were killed in shoot-outs and dozens of hostages were taken.[8]
dataA.partOf: Internal conflict in Bangladesh, Attacks by Islamic extremists in Bangladesh

dataA.details: Unknown militants detonated a bomb near a shop on the outskirts of Yusufiyeh, south of Iraq's capital Baghdad, killing one man and injuring ten others.[9]

Unknown militants hacked a Buddhist farmer named Mong Shwe Lung Marma (55), a local official of Bangladesh Awami League, to death in southern Bangladesh. Islamic State-affiliated media said the group carried out the attack.[10]
dataA.partOf: Internal conflict in Bangladesh, attacks by Islamic extremists in Bangladesh

dataA.details: A Hindu temple worker was hacked to death by three suspected Islamic militants on motorcycles in Jhenaidah. The victim's name was Shaymanonda Das.[11]
dataA.partOf: Attacks by Islamic extremists in Bangladesh

dataA.details: Elizabeth Aguilera, a political activist and a local leader of Venezuela's governing socialist political party, was shot dead by a paramilitary group, in retaliation for her work against organized crime in Venezuela. Her body was burned with pictures being posted on-line after her death.[12]
Two gunmen on motorcycles fired at a man on his way to a market in the Dera Murda Jamali area of Balochistan. The gunmen fled the scene and no group claimed responsibility.[13]
A Syrian warplane crashed, either from technical problems or being shot down. The pilot, who survived, was then kidnapped and executed.[14]
A suicide bomber on a motorcycle targeted a local tribal elder. The blast killed at least two civilians and wounded eighteen, but the tribal elder was unharmed.[15]
Al-Shabaab militants launched 11 mortars in close succession, killing two girls, aged four and five. 19 civilians were wounded.[16]
An Islamic State sniper assassinated an Iraqi military commander on Khalediya Island, some 20 km east of Ramadi.[17]
An employee of the Iraqi Ministry of Migration and Displacement was shot dead in his vehicle. No group claimed responsibility for the attack[18]
An Islamic State suicide attack was foiled, with an unknown number of attackers killed.[19]
A gunman stormed a house and killed at least seven members of the family. Some family members were able to defend themselves before being killed, and they shot and killed the attacker.[20]
A roadside bomb killed at least four soldiers, with some sources claiming five were killed.[21]

2016 Karrada bombing: At least 346 people were killed, and over 246 injured, in a series of coordinated bomb attacks in Baghdad. Early in the evening of July 3, a large car bomb exploded in the middle of a busy market, killing nearly 346 civilians.[22] The blast occurred in the Baghdad neighborhood of Karrada, which contains Shia Muslims and a large Christian minority. A second car bombing in the district of Sha'ab killed at least 5 people and injured 16, while two more bombings killed at least two more people.[23][24]
Islamic State executed 15 people. The victims included civilians charged by a court and ex-Islamic State members who were accused of "cowardice".[25]
At least 2 people were killed and 7 injured after an attack by suspected Islamic militants targeting policemen and civilians.[26]
A civilian was killed by gunmen in central al-Maqdadiya.[27]
Seven rebel commanders were killed by a suicide bomber of ISIS.[28]
Near Khartsyzk, a commander of militants was killed in a land mine blast.[29]
A senior Somali military commander, Abdiwali Siad, was wounded in an assassination attempt by unknown gunmen.[30]

dataA.location: Jeddah, Qatif and Medina, Saudi Arabia
dataA.details: 2016 Saudi Arabia bombings: A man blew himself up after police tried to arrest him near the United States consulate in Jeddah. Two Saudi police officers were injured in the blast.[31] Two suicide bombers targeted a Shia mosque in Qatif, but failed to harm anyone but themselves.[32] A suicide bomber targeted security forces outside the Prophet's Mosque in Medina killing 4 and wounding 5 others.[33]
Two people were killed and nine injured after an IED bombing near a market.[34]

At least 50 people were injured when Camp Liberty, a camp housing the People’s Mojahedin Organization of Iran, the main opposition party to the Iranian regime, was shelled. Over 50 rockets and mortar rounds hit the camp, which is located near Baghdad International Airport, causing extensive damage.[35]

Two people were injured when Nigerian troops shot and killed three female suicide bombers who were targeting internally displaced persons in northern Nigeria. The injuries came as a result of one of the suicide bomber's vest exploding.[36]

dataA.location: Beni Territory, Democratic Republic of Congo
dataA.details: Nine people were killed in a nighttime attack by Ugandan rebels in the city of Oisha, located in the North Kivu province of the DRC.[37]
A police officer was injured when a suicide bomber on a motorcycle detonated his explosives after being denied entry to a local police station.[38]
At least 25 people died in a suicide car bombing in the Kurdish-controlled city of Al-Hasakah, Syria.[39][40][41]
At least 4 people were killed and 9 injured after two explosions in Baghdad.[42]
Seven Islamic State fighters were boiled to death for attempting to flee the battlefield.[43]
3 people were killed and 12 injured after a shelling attack of three mortars on a refugee camp.[44]
Islamic State militants kidnapped 40 civilians in a town in Aleppo province, and subsequently executed them for trying to escape.[45]
At least nine civilians were injured when a hand grenade was tossed into an open market.[46]
A series of coordinated attacks targeting policemen and mosque attendees left two people dead, and six injured.[47][48]
Two workers for the telecommunications company Hormud were executed for "cooperating with the enemy", after the government executed several terrorist group members.[49]

RENAMO militants attacked during early morning. According to the commander of the provincial police in Tete Mozambique, Pedro Fabião Nhancololo, the group broke into the residence of the head of the city of Banga and civil registration facilities, and stole all drugs health post.[50]

Militants launched an attack against the airport army headquarters adjacent to Aden International Airport starting with two suicide car bombs. The militants then stormed the facility and engaged in a firefight with security forces. At least 25 security personal were killed and at least 8 were wounded.[51]
Three soldiers of the Israeli army were wounded in a vehicular attack in Gush Etzion. A Palestinian driver rammed a military vehicle at the intersection of Neve Daniel.[52][53]
A village guard was killed in an attack by outlawed PKK militants in the southeastern province of Hakkâri.[54]
At least 4 people were killed and 2 injured after a suicide bombing that targeted a former Jihadi leader (who was not killed) and his family.[55]
Two civilians were killed and two soldiers injured after attacks by insurgents. The suspected assailants were then attacked in retaliation, with 2 of them being killed.[56]
Gideon Aremun a Nigerian lawmaker and member of the House of Assembly, was assassinated by gunmen.[57][58]
Militants used homemade explosives and guns to attack policemen guarding an Eid al-Fitr prayer gathering.[59]
At least twelve Libyan soldiers were killed, over 35 injured in the explosion of a car bomb in Benghazi in eastern Libya.[60]
Islamic State executed 5 Sunni tribesmen accused of being with the Popular Mobilization Forces[61]

Muhammad ibn Ali al-Hadi Mausoleum attack: At least 56 people were killed and 75 injured after a suicide car bomb blew up at the gate of the Mausoleum of Sayid Mohammed bin Ali al-Hadi. Gunmen then entered the mausoleum and started shooting at the people inside.[62][63][64] Islamic State claimed that they killed over 100 people.
2 Syrian men were making homemade explosives, when they blew up, killing them and injuring a woman who was in another room. Terrorism is suspected.[65]
4 separate rocket attacks ended up with the death of 5 civilians, including children, and the injury of at least 9 people. Many buildings were also damaged.[66]
dataA.perpetrator: al-Nusra Front and others groups suspected

dataA.details: Two children were killed in a shelling by Islamic State in the Sinai peninsula province militants.The casualties were identified as Reda Ahmed, 16, and his sister Fatma, 6. Their other sibling Mariam, 6, was injured and taken to the Arish general hospital for medical treatment.[67]
The attack on the shrine of seven Dujai: At least 36 people were killed in a bombing near a shrine that is north of Baghdad.[68]
At least 9 people were killed and "dozens" injured after a suicide bombing attack on a Mosque in Borno. There was also a second suicide bombing at another Mosque.[69]
At least 36 people were killed and over 143 injured after mortar and other attacks in Aleppo. Rebel terrorist militant groups were behind the attacks.[70]
Two Russian military personnel were killed when Islamic State shot down their chopper near Palmyra.[71]
10 militants were killed in counter-terrorism raids across the country. 3 members of the Afghan National Security Forces were also killed during the raids[72]
2 soldiers and 1 civilian were killed in a car bombing in Southeast Turkey.[73]
An Israeli driver was moderately wounded in a drive-by shooting.[74]

5 people were executed by Islamic State, including 4 members of a football team, as they consider football "anti-Islamic". 4 other people were also executed for allegedly spying for the Kurdish YPG.[75]

At least 3 people were killed, all children, and 6 injured after an IED blew up when a civilian vehicle drove over it.[76] The Taliban are heavily suspected to be behind the bombing, although they have not claimed responsibility yet. 4 more people were killed and 2 injured after a shooting targeting policemen.[77]
A Christian preacher was hacked to death by suspected Muslim extremists.[78]
Boko Haram militants raided a town with guns and explosives, killing 7 people and damaging buildings.[79]
Two Malian soldiers were killed in an attack near the border with Burkina Faso.[80]
Multiple terrorist attacks by Fulani herdsmen left at least 81 people dead.[81][82]
The deputy mayor of the Wouro-Mody commune, Kola H. Dia,was killed by terrorists in the Mopti region.[83]
Unknown assailants opened fire on a police vehicle patrolling in the Dereli district. A police officer was injured in the attack.[84]
Another two police officers were wounded when an explosive was detonated near the scene of the first attack .[84]

At least 10 soldiers were killed in a suicide bombing at the Lanta Buro Base near Mogadishu. Militants then entered the base and took control of it. Al-Shabab released a statement claiming that it had killed 30 soldiers.[85][86]
Two policemen were killed when an IED exploded by their car. Three others were wounded.[87]
At least 12 civilians were killed in a suicide car bombing which targeted a Shiite open market. 5 more people were killed in separate bombings[88][89]
11 people were killed and 32 injured after a car bomb attack in a market.[90]
Islamic State executed 4 doctors for refusing to fight for them and treat their injured.[91]
A Saudi border guard was killed by a land mine near the border with Yemen.[92]
A Boko Haram attack in Borno State was repelled by the Nigerian Army resulting in the deaths of 25 militants. Two soldiers were killed during the attack.[93][94]
ISIS executed 7 people from one of their secret prisons in Libya. Three people were found critically injured by Libyan forces, although more may have been likely injured.[95]
Close to President Pierre Nkurunziza, the former minister Hafsa Mossi was murdered in Bujumbura. She had been very quiet since the beginning of the crisis.[96]
At least 7 people were killed in a suicide car bombing which targeted a military checkpoint in northern Baghdad.[97] 11 people were injured, some critically.[98]
2 people were killed and an unknown numbers of attackers were killed after a shooting that targeted a tribal sheikh.[99]

2 people were killed and at least 7 injured after two bombings in and around Baghdad. One bombing was an IED that killed a doctor while he was driving his vehicle, another bombing blew up at a traffic intersection.[100][101]
Near Krasnohorivka, two Ukrainians soldiers were wounded in a land mine blast.[102]

dataA.location: Rutshuru Territory, Democratic Republic of Congo
dataA.details: Two people died and two were injured in an attack of AFDRC position in Tongo-Rusheshe in Rutshuru Territory.[103]
Al-Hashd al-Shaabi foiled an attack by Islamic State suicide bombers, killing an unknown number of them.[104]  Although, 6 were wounded in other attack on them.[105][106]
A mass execution by ISIS included 22 police members and 5 members of Peshmerga.[107]
Three marine soldiers were killed by gunmen while they were procuring provisions.[108]
Islamic State shot down a Syrian Arab Air Force fighter jet which likely killed the pilot, crucifying his corpse.[109]

2016 Nice attack: On the evening of 14 July 2016, a 19 tonne cargo truck was deliberately driven into crowds celebrating Bastille Day on the Promenade des Anglais in Nice, France, resulting in the deaths of 86 people and injuring 434.[110]
Eight terrorists opened fire on policemen, injuring 2 of them. The policemen then killed 6 terrorists in retaliation.[111]

dataA.location: Rutshuru Territory, Democratic Republic of Congo
dataA.details: Two people, aged 25 and 26, were shot dead by Mai-Mai militiamen in Rutshuru Territory in North Kivu. They were killed while chopping wood in the forest.[112]
A roadside bombing killed 2 Kenyan soldiers and one Somali soldier. Militants then engaged in a firefight with the soldiers.[113]
Two civilians, including a child, were wounded early on July 15 when PKK militants staged armed attacks against a military barracks and a police station in the southeastern Siirt Province.[114]
One person was killed and 7 injured after a grenade attack on policemen in Kulgam, India.[115]
An Indian chief was shot dead Saturday in the Venezuelan city of Rosario de Perija in Zulia (west), reported the Public Ministry.[116]
Islamic State burned 5 civilians alive in a cage for allegedly spying and working with the Iraqi security forces.[117]
Three people were killed and 6 injured after an IED bombing near a market.[118]
An IED bombing killed Sami al-Hassan, a leader of Popular Mobilization Forces, while he was in his moving vehicle. It was a targeted attack.[119]
A plot to blow up a bridge over the Tigris River was foiled after an airstrike on a boat carrying many explosives.[120]

Eight militants were killed while seven soldiers were wounded in hostilities this week in the province, sparked by an attack last Wednesday on an Army team studying Moro culture in Mamasapano town.[121]
In Avdiivka, one person was wounded as a result of DPR shelling.[122]
In Marinka, a local woman was wounded as a result of DPR shelling.[123]
1 person was killed and 4 injured after an IED bombing targeting a police patrol, killing one policeman and damaging a vehicle.[124]
5 people were killed and 6 injured after a terrorist group fired 5 rockets into a civilian area, damaging many buildings.[125]

2016 shooting of Almaty police officers: Six people were killed, and eight others were injured following an attack on a police station in Almaty, Kazakhstan’s largest city. One of the attackers has been detained.[126]
An assailant stabbed and injured two soldiers. Responding to the threat, the soldiers shot at the attacker and detained him. He died of his injuries a day later.[127]
Eleven people, including four civilians, were killed and eighteen people were injured in twin suicidal car bombings.[128]
An attack by Islamic State was repelled. The only known casualties are the death of three Islamic State suicide bombers, 3 policemen, and the injury of 5 civilians.[129][130]
One person was killed and 5 injured after an IED bombing that targeted soldiers. A vehicle was also damaged.[131]

At least 9 soldiers and militants were killed, 25 wounded and four missing after heavy fighting between moderate Islamist militias allied to the former national government and parliament loyal supporters of Tobruk Army, the military said.[132]
An attack by Islamic State on Popular Mobilization Forces injured seven people. Seven Islamic State members were then killed in retaliation.[133]

2016 Würzburg train attack: 5 people were injured, 2 of them critically, when a 17-year-old Afghan asylum seeker attacked passengers on a train with an axe and a knife. The attacker was killed by police.[134]

2016 Nampala attack: Gunmen attacked a Malian Army base near the town of Nampala in central Mali, close to the border with Mauritania.[135][136] 17 soldiers were killed and 35 others were wounded in the attack, which was jointly claimed by three separate groups.[137]
dataA.perpetrator: Macina Liberation Front  AQIM  Ethnic Peul militants

dataA.details: One person was killed after a Fulani herdsman named Amidu Omuru killed and robbed a man using a shepherd club and a machete.[138]
Seven people were killed and five others wounded during an incursion of armed men in Kibiriz.[139]
In Avdiivka, a 19-year-old man was killed as a result of DPR shelling.[140]
Two suicide bombings killed at least 10 people and injured 18 at Yemeni military checkpoints.[141]
Two bombings in Baghdad resulted in the deaths of a policeman and a member of Popular Mobilization Forces. Three other people were critically injured, and several vehicles were damaged.[142][143]

Five Malaysian citizens have been kidnapped by the Abu Sayyaf Filipino jihadist group, related to the Islamic State (EI) in waters of the Malaysian state of Sabah in northeast Borneo, the Philippine government said Tuesday.[citation needed]
Suicide bombings by 6 assailants were foiled with an unknown number of assailants killed.[144]
12 protesting civilians were shot dead by Islamic State. In retaliation, Iraqi soldiers killed 20 Islamic State  members.[145]
Two people died and five others were wounded after militiamen attacked a truck Kyanyunda.[146]
Al-Shabaab killed at least five soldiers serving with Somali National Army (SNA) in Balad city,30 km southwest of Mogadishu.[147]
A young Palestinian boy named Abdullah Issa was beheaded for allegedly being a member of Liwa al-Quds.[148][149]
The journalist Pavel Sheremet was killed when a bomb exploded under his car in the center of Kiev.[150]
Islamic State militants executed 33 civilians near Qayyarah.[151]
1 person was killed and 2 injured after a sniper attack at an army checkpoint.[152]
A terrorist attack was foiled by Buraq Popular Mobilization Forces members and border guards with an unknown number of casualties. Vehicles were destroyed.[153]
Five people were killed and 6 injured after a suicide bombing targeting policemen.[154]
Two bombings in and around Baghdad resulted in two deaths and 10 injuries. Several vehicles were also damaged.[155][156]

Five Mai-Mai militiamen tried to attack a prison in Mitwaba. In the confrontation they beheaded a policeman and cut his body into pieces. The police subsequently killed three militiamen and wounded the remaining two, who were then arrested.[157]
Unknown militants opened fire on a passenger bus, killing at least 2 people.[158]

In the province of Diyarbakır Ergani in the operation organized members of the PKK organization, three policemen were killed and a policeman was injured. Security officers organized operation to an address that was used as a "nest" .One of the two wounded policemen entered the Ergani State Hospital fell despite the effort[159]

2016 Munich shooting: A gunman opened fire on a shopping mall, killing nine before committing suicide. 36 people were wounded, four by gunfire. The shooter was a bullied man who was said to be obsessed with mass shootings. The massacre was conducted on the anniversary of the 2011 Norway attacks. The suspect was described as being a "very nationalistic" racist, with him boasting about similarities with Adolf Hitler.

July 2016 Kabul bombing: Two suicide bombers targeted ethnic Hazaras at a rally in Kabul, killing over 80 people and wounding at least 230 more. Islamic State later claimed responsibility for the attack.[160][161]
1 person was killed and 4 injured after an IED bombing on an army patrol.[163]
6 people were killed and 8 injured after a roadside bombing targeted civilians attempting to flee Islamic State.[164]
Two IED bombings resulted in the deaths of 3 people and the injury of 13.[165]
An Islamic State suicide bombing attack was foiled by Peshmerga, with at least 5 attackers being killed, 9 being injured, and a vehicle being destroyed.[166]
An Islamic State suicide bombing attack was foiled by the Nineveh Operations with dozens of assailants being killed.[167]

A suicide bombing in the Shiite neighborhood of Kadhimiya in Baghdad left at least 21 people dead.[168] More bombings left 5 people dead and 15 wounded. Islamic State claimed responsibility for the first attack, and is suspected in the others.[169][170]
An IED bombing killed 1 person and injured 2, targeting families fleeing from Islamic State.[171]
Islamic State burned 3 family members to death, including a 2-year-old-girl, for trying to escape ISIS-held territory.[172]
An Arish police captain was killed in a targeted assassination. Islamic State claimed responsibility.[173]

2016 Ansbach bombing: A 27-year-old Syrian refugee detonated a bomb at a wine bar in Ansbach, killing only himself, but wounding 15 civilians. He had previously been denied entry to a nearby music festival. Authorities found a recorded video message on the attacker's phone, pledging his allegiance the Islamic State.[174]

A Syrian asylum seeker armed with a döner knife attacked a co-worker and bystanders in Reutlingen, Germany, killing the coworker, a pregnant Polish woman, and wounding two other people in the forearm and head, before being subdued by a civilian who hit him with a car and arrested by police.[2]
Three policemen were killed in a PKK roadside bomb attack in Turkey's southeastern Mardin Province.[175]
A suicide car bombing at a checkpoint in central Iraq killed at least 17 people.[176][177]

An IED bombing at a market in the eastern Baghdad suburb of Al-Amin al-Thaniyah left 2 people dead and 7 injured.[178] Another IED bombing killed 1 and injured 4, and another killed 2 and injured 6.[179][180]
An Islamic State mortar attack resulted in 30 casualties.[181]
Islamic State executed 23 people for allegedly working with Iraqi forces.[182]

A RENAMO Gunmen from Mozambique’s opposition party Renamo on morning attacked a health centre and a police station in the administrative post of Muapula in the northern province of Niassa. The armed men stole medicines and surgical equipment from the health centre. No casualties have been reported.[183]
Two truck drivers received minor injuries over the weekend when a convoy driving along the EN7 highway was ambushed by gunmen from the opposition party Renamo.[184]

At least thirteen people were killed, and five injured, when two suicide car bombs exploded near an African Union base in the Somali capital of Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[185][186]
A truck bomb exploded when passing on a landmine in the eastern city of Van, killing one person and injuring two more.[187]
One soldier was killed and another injured in a rocket attack on a military checkpoint near the Silvan Dam.[187]

2016 Normandy church attack: Two assailants killed a priest and seriously wounded a woman in a church in Saint-Étienne-du-Rouvray. The two assailants were killed by French Special Forces. Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[188][189]
Multiple bombings in Baghdad left 2 people dead and 9 wounded.[190][191][192]
A bombing at the headquarters of Popular Mobilization Forces left an unknown number of casualties.[193]
A family of 5 people was killed in a path-side explosion.[194]
27 July 2016 Qamishli bombings: A terrorist detonated his van packed with explosives at a checkpoint in the Kurdish city of Qamishli. At least 48 were killed and 140 were wounded[195][196][197]

A suicide bomber detonated his explosives at a checkpoint in a Shiite neighborhood in Baghdad killing 6 people and wounding at least 15.[198] Other attacks in and around Baghdad killed a further 12 and injured 23 people.[199]
Another series of attacks in Baghdad left at least 12 people dead and at least 24 injured.[200][201][202] 4 attackers were also killed in the attacks.[203][204][205]
Two separate attacks in Anbar left 3 people dead and at least 4 wounded, including a military commander.[206][207]
Islamic State executed 25 people in the teacher's institute during their occupation of Fallujah.[208]
A military vehicle exploded when passing on a landmine in the eastern district of Siirt, killing two soldiers and injuring two more.[209]
A bomb detonated in a market selling qat in Marib killing 7 and injuring 18.[210]
Islamic State executed 14 civilians who were attempting to flee the city.[211]

At least 9 people were killed and at least 19 were wounded in several incidents. In the first, an IED bombing in northern Baghdad killed two people and injured eleven others.[212] In the second, an IED bombing in the al-Amel neighborhood in southwest Baghdad killed one person and injured eight others.[213] In the third, a refugee camp in Baghdad was shelled with mortars killing 5 people. Lastly, a suicide bomber killed a police officer named Shafi Alwataifi who prevented him from entering a crowded market by embracing him.[214][215]
Islamic State executed a person for allegedly working with Iraqi forces.[216]
Two patrons were killed in a shooting in a pub.Four people were injured in the attack.One of the attackers were killed[217]
Mai-Mai attack an army positions in Nyamilima (North Kivu). An old women was wounded.[218]
Islamic State executed 24 civilians in a village near Manbij.[219]
Five soldiers were killed, and 8 were injured in a PKK attack in Çukurca.[220]

A 17-year Mennonite guerrillas kidnapped by Paraguayan People's Army (EPP), read a statement sent today by the armed group that he founded the kidnapping by "the violation of revolutionary laws prohibiting deforestation."[221]
An police patrol was attacked by Islamic State members.[222]
Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda (FLEC) reportedly killed nine Angolan soldiers and wounded 14 others in recent clashes in the oil-rich Cabinda Province. (Reuters)
dataA.perpetrator: Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda

dataA.details: A bomb killed 2 and injured 8, in a popular market in the south of Baghdad.[223]

A group of 20 armed men invaded the village of the headquarters of the Renamo Mopeia province of Zambezia, in central Mozambique district and occupied the police headquarters for an hour, normalcy returned after the departure of men (RENAMO), after a 45-minute shootout with police.[224]
A roadside bomb exploded by a vehicle carrying paramilitary rangers killing one and wounding eight.[225]

Renamo gunmen overran Sunday Maiaca city in the province of Niassa, northern Mozambique, and attacked the health center, police facilities and the administrator's house, local sources cited by Radio Mozambique.[226]

Two suicide car bombs targeted the Somalia's Criminal Investigative Police Division headquarters killing five civilians and one police officer. Five gunmen then attempted to storm the building but were killed by security forces.[227][228][229]

Four gunmen stormed into an oil station of the North Oil Company, situated some 20 kilometers from western Kirkuk. Firing indiscriminately, the gunmen injured two guards and killed four employees who were stationed in the control room. The gunmen then escaped to another oil station 25 kilometers north of the first one where three of then set off their suicide vests. The fourth was killed in a shootout with security forces. One person was killed and 6 were injured at the second oil station.[230][231][232]

1. An IED exploded near a lake at Suteih village in Madain district in southern Baghdad, killing two persons and wounding three others.[233] 2. A family of 7 was gunned down by unknown militants who stormed the family's home.[234] 3. An IED bombing in northern Baghdad killed at least 2 and injured 9 others.[235]
A suicide car bomb targeted the headquarters of border police in Anbar Province killing two and injuring five.[236]

Police were able to stop terrorists from killing civilians, and they were attacked instead with an unknown number of casualties. Seven militants were killed.[237] 11 more militants were killed at a different time.[citation needed]

2016 Yerevan hostage crisis: About 20 gunmen took control of a police station, killing two officers. 77 people were injured and 100 others were arrested. 3 gunmen were also injured. Hostages were taken. The gunmen surrendered on July 31, two weeks after seizing the police station.[238]
A captain of the Malian army was shot dead by four AQIM gunmen in Timbuktu in northern Mali.[239]

August 2016 Kabul attack: A massive truck bomb exploded outside a hotel popular with foreigners in Kabul at around 1:30 a.m. local time. The blast was heard throughout the city and much of the city had lost power shortly before the blast. Four gunmen tried to storm the hotel but engaged in a shootout with security forces killing one person and injuring four. Three of the four attackers also died. The Taliban claimed responsibility.[1][2]
A truck exploded near police cars. Seven policeman were killed and two others injured.[3][4]

1. A bomb blast at Jafri Naddaf area, south-east of Baghdad killed at least two persons and injured four others.[5]  2. An IED explosion earlier in the day at northeast of Baghdad killed at least one person and injured seven others.[6] 3. A soldier was killed and two others injured in a sniper attack at an army checkpoint in Tarmiya in northern Baghdad.[7]
Militants shelled a town in the Jizan Region from across the border with Yemen killing four civilians and injuring three.[8]
A terrorist attack by ISIS was foiled by the Popular Mobilization Forces with 7 assailants being killed. Four people were injured and vehicles were destroyed.[9]
A Russian Mi-8 medical transport helicopter was shot down, with all 5 people on board being killed.[10]
Shelling by the so-called Islamic State killed at least 31 people, likely more. In retaliation, at least 20 rebels were killed.[11]
Unidentified gunmen stormed a house in the Baghdad suburb of Hayy al-Nasr, killing three women inside.[12]

The Joint Command of the Armed Forces reported that yesterday at 11 pm suspected terrorists attacked a military base in the mazamari district, in the Valley of the Apurimac River, Ene and Mantaro (abbreviated commonly VRAEM), leaving the balance of a wounded soldier.[13]
Two suicide car bombings killed 6 soldiers between a military base.[14]
22 people were killed by a car bomb that targeted security forces in a residential area of Benghazi. Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries claimed responsibility.[15][16][17]
Four border policemen and a civilian were injured in a double bombing attack in Saba Yoi District in Songkhla yesterday morning.[18]
Two village defence volunteers suffered minor injuries when a bomb exploded in front of a school in Khok Pho District in Pattani Province the same day.[18]
Five villagers were killed in an attack by Fulani herdsmen in Nigeria's northern state of Kaduna.[19]
Killed two fighters YPG volunteers, a British and Slovenian, in a clash against isis in the Syrian town of manbij (northwest).[20]

Gunmen attacked and attempted to burn the house of a woman whom they accused of dating a militant wanted for being a member of the Paraguayan People's Army (EPP). It happened during the early hours of Wednesday in the city of Itauguá.[21]
At least 7 people were killed and 25 injured after toxic shelling of civilian areas.[22]
An IED bombing killed at least one member of Popular Mobilization Forces and injured 6.[23] Dozens of terrorists were also killed and structures were destroyed.[24]

Two buses carrying foreign tourists—including eight Britons, two Americans, and a German—were attacked by Taliban gunmen near Herat, Afghanistan. Ten tourists were killed and four others wounded, as well as the driver. The attackers were eventually driven back by Afghan soldiers.[25]
A bomb blast north of Baqubah killed one Popular Mobilization Forces member and injured three others.[26]
Islamic State executed 12 people whom they accused of fleeing Hawija District in Kirkuk.[27]
1 person was killed and 1 injured during an armed robbery.[28]
At least 30 civilians were killed by shelling.[29] In retaliation, 50 rebels were killed and 10 injured.
A homosexual Syrian man was beheaded by an Islamic terror group in a series of similar murders.[30]

The Seventh Army Division confirmed that the organized armed group Clan Gulf freed Cristofer professional soldier Rodriguez Cardozo, who had been abducted 18 hours earlier in Arboletes, Antioquia. Later, a member of the "Clan Gulf" group was detained in a military operation.[31]
Two Turkish soldiers were killed in a PKK ambush in the Şemdinli department of Hakkari Province. Another six soldiers were wounded in the ensuing firefight.[32]
At least two soldiers were wounded during a clash between government troops and suspected New People's Army rebels in Monkayo, in the Compostela Valley.[33]

2016 Kokrajhar shooting: six terrorists, suspected to be Bodo militants, attacked the Balajan Tinali market area in the city of Kokrajhar in Assam with AK-47s and grenades, killing 14 and injuring 15.[34]

Igor Plotnitsky, head of the Luhansk People's Republic, was injured by a powerful explosion that occurred near his car. The rebel leader was admitted to a local hospital, along with several others injured in the explosion. A senior rebel later told the Interfax news agency that the explosion was a terrorist act, but did not accuse any group or individual.[36][37]
2016 Charleroi attack: Two policewomen were attacked by man wielding a machete and shouting ‘Allahu Akbar' in the Belgian city of Charleroi. The assailant was shot and killed by a third officer.[38]

At least 85 people were killed and hundreds kidnaped and held hostage after a massacre carried out by the Islamic State.[39] ISIS also kidnapped over 3000 more people and executed 15 in the same city, before the event listed first.[40]

Three members of the Colombian guerrillas of the ELN (National Liberation Army) killed in a clash with the army of Venezuela. According to Colombian authorities, the confrontation occurred on Friday when guerrillas crossed the border between the municipality of Saravena, in the Colombian department of Arauca, and the town of El Nula, in the Venezuelan state of Apure.[41]

A woman and her daughter were killed in a drive-by shooting in the Upper Dir region of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The woman allegedly married without her family's permission, a perceived break of Islamic Law.[42]
Suspected al-Shabaab militants launched mortar fire against densely populated residential areas of Baidoa. No casualties were reported.[43]

At least one member of the mission of the United Nations in Mali (MINUSMA) died and four more were wounded (all of Chadian nationality) in the explosion of a land mine in the Kidal region of northern Mali.[44]
Islamic State burned eight people alive in western Kirkuk province, allegedly for trying to escape.[45]
A gunfight between militants of the PKK and Turkish soldiers in the rural village of Akmeşe near the city of Siirt left one soldier dead and four wounded.[46]
A series of suicide bombings killed 11 Iraqis and injured 7 more.[47]
At least ten soldiers loyal to Yemeni President Abdo Rabu Mansur Hadi were killed in a suicide car bombing in the southern region of Yafa.[48]
At least 10 soldiers were killed and nine wounded in recent fighting between the government and the Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda.[49]
At least 14 civilians were killed when Mai Mai militants attacked a village in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. The militants were eventually driven off by government forces.[50][51]
dataA.perpetrator: Mai Mai and Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda blamed.

dataA.details: August 2016 Quetta attacks: A suicide bomb attack killed at least 93 people and wounded dozen others[52] at a hospital in Quetta in southwest Pakistan, and injured around 120 more.[53]

Northern Irish Police (PSNI) arrested a man suspected of being involved with the assassination of John Boreland Protestant paramilitary leader, shot dead in north Belfast last Sunday. Boreland, 46, was one of the leaders of the Ulster Defence Association (UDA)[54]
Four Abu Sayyaf militants died in a battle with members of the Moro National Liberation Front early Tuesday in the Philippines' southern province of Sulu, military officials said.[55]
A blasts kill at least 4 people, and injure dozens more, in Mardin province and Kiziltepe.[56]
A blasts kill at least 5 people, and injured 10 more in Diyarbakir, Turkey.[56]

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police killed Aaron Driver, a 24-year-old allegiant of the Islamic State armed with a bomb, in the town of Strathroy during an anti-terror operation after receiving a tip from the Federal Bureau of Investigation that a suicide bombing was imminent within 72 hours in a major Canadian city; some media guessed Toronto.[57][58]
dataA.partOf: Spillover of the Syrian Civil War

dataA.details: A suicide bomber killed two people and wounded at least 15 others at a crowded market.[59]
Boko Haram militants burned 60 houses, shot four villagers dead, and abducted one child.[60]

Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) says it has thwarted two armed Ukrainian incursions into Crimea with at least two killed, including one FSB officer, following a "massive fire fight" with "sabotage-terrorist" groups. Ukraine denies the Russian claims. (Reuters) (The Guardian)
ISIS burned 20 people to death for refusing to join them.[61]

In the municipality of El Retorno (Guaviare), 6:30 pm a label attached to a motorcycle bomb exploded and wounded two auxiliary police, two civilians and a child of a year and a half. The first front of the FARC[62]

August 2016 Thailand bombings: Two bombs exploded in Hua Hin at about 10:20 p.m. local time on 11 August. One Thai woman selling fruit on the street was killed and 23 people, including twelve foreigners, were injured. The injured include two English, two Dutch, one German and seven from Austria and Italy.[63]
An 18-year-old Israeli was stabbed with a screwdriver by a Palestinian who ran away from the scene of the attack.[64]
One person was killed and 2 injured after an explosive attack on police in Kurdistan by multiple assailants.[65]
dataA.partOf: Spillover of the Syrian Civil War

dataA.details: A man executed his father for assisting his family in escaping.[66]
August 2016 Thailand bombings: Three explosions occurred in Hua Hin on 12 August, killing one and injuring at least four others.[67]
August 2016 Thailand bombings: A bomb that had been hidden in a flower pot exploded outside the Surat Thani police station and killed a municipal employee.[67]
August 2016 Thailand bombings: A bombing occurred in Trang.[67] One person was killed.[68]
Fulani herdsmen have killed at least 13 Christians and displaced hundreds of church members during an attack on a cluster of villages in Kaduna state, according to local sources.[69]

Armed men from the military wing of the National Mozamboqueña Resistance (RENAMO) has attacked a convoy in the province of Manica that moved to follow the president's visit, Filipe Nyusi, to the region. The attack has resulted in one minor injury.[70]
Unknown assailants throw a grenade into a group of Hindu pilgrims before speeding off.[71]
A female attacked a female soldier in the Northern West Bank near the Shaked settlement Sunday evening. The attacker was subdued, while the soldier received only minor injuries[72]

dataA.location: Beni City, Democratic Republic of the Congo
dataA.details: Beni massacre: At least 64 to 101 people were found killed in the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo’s (DR Congo) Beni city, media reported Sunday. The information was confirmed by city’s Mayor Nyonyi Bwanakawa, Xinhua news agency reported.Country’s President Joseph Kabila called the deadly massacre an act of terrorism.[73]

dataA.location: Tshimbulu, Democratic Republic of the Congo
dataA.details: Tshimbulu incident: Policemen intervened in a terrorist attack by a militia. 11 policemen were killed and 8 terrorists were also killed, with 40 militants being captured. The leader of the militia was also killed. Four policemen went missing.

2016 Atmeh attackAt least 32 people were killed in a suicide bombing on a bus in Syria's northwestern Idlib province late Sunday, according to local sources. A bomber blew himself up on a bus carrying opposition fighters at the entrance of Atmeh camp, the sources told Anadolu Agency.[74][75]
Two Lebanese Army soldiers were reportedly wounded on Monday when a roadside bomb struck their military vehicle near the village of Ras Al-Sarj in the Arsal Municipality.[76]
dataA.partOf: Syrian Civil War spillover in Lebanon

dataA.details: At least two people were wounded Monday in a bombing that unfolded outside the U.S. Embassy in Afghanistan's capital city, Kabul, an Afghan official told The Associated Press.[77]

Gunmen from the opposition party Renamo on Friday killed six people when they ambushed a car at Nangue, in the district of Cheringoma, in the central Mozambican province of Sofala. The gunmen shot at the car and brought it to a standstill. The vehicle was then set on fire with the six occupants still inside.[78]
A volunteer from Berdiansk was killed during the shelling of Chermalyk at around 02:00 am.
ISIS executed 25 civilians after they were accused of "spying".[79]
A bombing on escaping civilians killed 5 or 25 people and injured 20.[80]
ISIS executed 6 people using molten tar after being 'accused' of cooperating with enemies of ISIS, and another person for "dressing like a woman" in another in a series of executions.[81][82]
Houthi shelling kills seven in Saudi Arabia.[83]
Suicide bombing attacks were foiled, with four terrorists being killed and 6 arrested.[84]
dataA.partOf: Spillover of the Syrian Civil War

dataA.details: Two Ukrainian servicemen were killed and four others wounded due to shelling in the industrial area of Avdiivka.

2016 Shchelkovo Highway police station attack: Two men with firearms and axes attacked the police station on 20th kilometer of Shchelkovo Highway near Moscow. Two traffic police officers were seriously injured, one of them died in the hospital.[85] Attackers, natives of the Chechen Republic, were killed during the attack. ISIL claimed responsibility for the attack.[86]

Three people were killed and 40 people were injured when a car bomb exploded outside a police station near the Iranian border. Seventeen of the injured were police officers and one of the dead was a child. PKK is believed to have been behind the attack.[87]
ISIS executed 7 people for refusing to send their children to schools run by ISIS.[88]
ISIS tortured and executed 13 people inside their prisons.[89]

At least eight soldiers of the Alliance of militias allied to the government of Libyan UN-backed unit were killed and eight wounded when a car bomb exploded two in the city of Sirte, the scene of heavy fighting for two months[90]
A car bombing killed 3 officers and another 217 were injured (85 being officers). The attack occurred in Elazig.[91][92]

Pro-Russian rebels launched over 500 mortar shells and over 300 artillery shells at Ukrainian forces, killing three soldiers and wounding six more in the worst violence seen in Eastern Ukraine in over a year.[93]
ISIS shelling killed 10 people and injured 26 during a gathering of displaced civilians who had escaped them.[94]

Colonel Fernando Murillo, director of the anti-kidnapping group Gaula of the National Police, confirmed Thursday the kidnapping of four rice farmers in Arauca by the Commission Rafael Villamizar Domingo Lain Front of the ELN.
Ten people were killed in a Christian-majority area of Kaduna state, Nigeria, on Tuesday, the latest in a string of attacks by Fulani herdsmen.[95]
A rabbi was stabbed in Strasbourg by a man reportedly shouting Allahu Akbar.[96]
A terrorist attack injured 2 policemen and resulted in the deaths of the 2 attackers[97]  After that a counter-terrorism raid killed 4 terrorists.[98]
At noon one Ukrainian serviceman was killed and four others were wounded in action in the Donbass region.
On August 20, 2016, Wasil Farooqui stabbed a man and a woman in a random attack at an apartment complex.[99]
August 2016 Gaziantep suicide bombing: A suicide bomb attack at a Kurdish wedding ceremony near the Syrian border killed at least 50 and injured 94. The suicide bomber was aged 12 to 14, reports say.
A bombing in Colombia's eastern Arauca region left one soldier wounded, and caused material damage to the local airport and adjacent properties.[100]
ISIS executed 14 civilians for allegedly cooperating with government and Kurdish Peshmerga forces.[101]
Boko Haram killed 7 people with machine guns, before abducting dozens more, in the village of Kuruburu[102]
An al-Shabaab suicide car bomb killed at least 20 people in the town of Galkayo in Somalia's semi-autonomous Puntland region.[103]
At least 3 people killed and another 24 were injured when a suicide bombing attack a market in the city of Mora.[104]
ISIS executed 4 people for "homosexuality and sodomy" by throwing them off of a building.[105]
30 policemen were tortured and killed by assailants in a village that was held by ISIS.[106]
A dead patrolman stopped the attackof the Gulf clan to uniformed National Police in the municipality of San Pedro de Uraba, Antioquia.[107]

dataA.location: Beni Region, Democratic Republic of Congo
dataA.details: Two People were killed in a machete attack in an eastern region (Beni Region) of Democratic Republic of Congo rebels Where Have Been Blamed for a series of civilian massacres, the army Said[109]
One person was killed and at least 30 were injured after a car bombing at a hotel in another in a series of terrorist attacks in the country.[110]

At least five Philippine troops have been killed in clashes with a Daesh-linked group as fighting resumed outside three towns in the Muslim south from which the military recently pushed back Abu Sayyaf militants.[111]
An IDF soldier was stabbed by a Palestinian who was shot dead[107]
Four Turkish soldiers were killed in a PKK ambush in the district of Lice in Diyarbakir province, in the southeast of the country.[112]
A soldier died after being hit by a mine during a military operation against PKK units in the province of Bingol in eastern Turkey.[112]

American University of Afghanistan attack: At least 17 people were killed and 50 more wounded in a bombing and shooting at the American University of Afghanistan in Kabul. The Taliban is believed to be behind the attack.[113]
An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded near a sheep market in the southwest Baghdad suburb of Suwaib, killing two people and injuring six more.[114]
Al-Shabab fighters attacked a beach restaurant in the capital Mogadishu with a car bomb before entering into a gunfight with security forces.10 killed[115]
One person was killed and 3 were injured after an assassination attempt on Turkish opposition leader Kemal Kilicdaroglu.[116][117]
A teenage hostage was reportedly executed after his family was unable to pay a ransom of one million pesos, causing President Rodrigo Duterte to order troops be sent to the area.[118]
ISIS killed 20 escaping civilians while kidnapping and injuring 45 more during an ambush.[119]
An Iraqi Kurdish journalist named Wedad Hussein Ali was kidnapped and killed by suspected Kurdish militants.[120]
Eleven policemen were killed and 78 injured when a car bomb exploded nearby a checkpoint. PKK claimed responsibility.[121]
The Deputy Interior Minister of Bolivia, Rodolfo Illanes, was beaten to death after he was kidnapped by striking miners after he attempted to "talk with them".[122]
Eight soldiers were killed in an attack by rebels. This is the deadliest attack of the Paraguayan People's Army.[123]
ISIS executed 15 people, and recorded it on video. Among the 15 executed were five Kurdish men from Rojava who were shot dead by five child soldiers of multiple nationalities.[124]
ISIS executed at least 48 civilians who were accused of attempting to escape them and collaborating with Iraqi forces.[125]
At least five people were killed and seven others injured in the region of Mopti in central Mali, following clashes between two ethnic groups, the government said in a statement.[126]
A land mine planted by Islamist group Boko Haram killed four Chadian soldiers on patrol near Chad's border with Niger on Saturday,security sources said.[127]
A man screamed “Allahu Akbar” as he attacked a couple with their own picnic knife at a German music festival.[128]
An ISIS suicide bomber and four gunmen slaughter 18 people to death and injured 26 at an Iraqi wedding.

Two Turkish soldiers were wounded in clashes with the PKK least seven militants of Kurdistan Workers' Party, considered by Turkey as a terrorist organization, and wounded two soldiers were wounded.[129]
Four people were injured when a man carrying bombs attacked a priest in a church on Indonesia's Sumatra island.[130]
A group of five assailants opened fire on residents of a neighbourhood near Iraq's Karbala.[131]
An Islamic State attack on a police headquarters in al-Ratba, Anbar Province, left five Iraqi soldiers dead, an army official said.[132]
August 2016 Aden bombing: At least 71 people were killed in a suicide car bombing at a military facility in the southern Yemen city of Aden.[131]
Three Tunisian soldiers were killed and seven more wounded after Islamic militants ambushed and fired rifles and rocket-propelled grenades at them near Mount Sammama.[133]

The gunmen attacked the police post, the health centre, the home of the head of the administrative post, and the local offices of the ruling Frelimo Party. According to the Murrupula district administrator, Antonio Saul, nobody died in the attack. The gunmen smashed windows in several buildings, including the health centre, and the administrative post offices.[134]
A Turkish soldier was killed and three others wounded on Sunday as a result of a bomb placed outside a road in southeastern Turkey.[135]
Chinese Embassy in Bishkek bombing: A car rammed through the gates of the Chinese Embassy in Bishkek and exploded, killing the driver and injuring at least three more people.[136]
A suicide car bomber rammed his truck into a hotel adjacent to the Presidential Palace killing at least 12 people and wounding 15.[137]
A policeman was wounded in a melee attack in a police station. The assailant was arrested by other policemen. He tried to kill the policeman because "It represents France".[138]
Islamic State executed 13 civilians for helping families escape.[139]
Assailants opened fire on a National Police of Colombia station in Arauca, Colombia.[140]
Militants threw a grenade in a police post in the town of Tame in Arauca Department[140]
A local nurse was wounded during enemy shelling of Shchastya.[141]
A car bombing killed a Syrian woman and wounded five people in Zahlé.[142]
